title.narrative: DON'T USE 602.02WASH SERVICES SCALING UP

description.narrative: By 2016, families living in rural and peri-urban communities with high rates of malnutrition, AWD/cholera and other water-related diseases have improved and sustained access to cost effective, gender sensitive and environment friendly Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services and practice proper hygiene behaviour, which contributes to Health â€“ General, Immunization, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Nutrition â€“ General, Sanitation, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Access to Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services will be expanded to reach an additional 1.4 million people

title.narrative: By 2016, families living in rural and peri-urban communities with high rates of malnutrition, AWD/cholera and other water-relateddiseases have improved and sustained access to cost effective, gender sensitive and environment friendly WASH services andpractice proper hygiene behaviour
